snippet: NBC, usually protective about the process of putting together Saturday Night Live, allowed access to the show’s writers, stars and rehearsals this week as they prepared their debate sketch.
abstract: Political season is high-anxiety time for Saturday Night Live, which even in the age of Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert is known for its definitive parodies of political debates; creator and executive producer Lorne Michaels and NBC, usually protective about the process of putting together the show, allowed access to the program’s writers, stars and rehearsals as they prepared their sketch following the first debate between Mitt Romney and Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: NBC, usually protective about the process of putting together Saturday Night Live, allowed access to the show’s writers, stars and rehearsals this week as they prepared their debate sketch.

headline.main: Spinning Gaffes Into Gags: Live From New York, It’s Debate Night
headline.print_headline: Spinning Gaffes Into Gags: Live From New York, It’s Debate Night
